intro: Mariscus amomodorus, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close during the day. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its showy, trumpet-shaped blooms. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
